options.title: -a
options.description: Display all files including those beginning with a period (.).

options.title: -b
options.description: Enable the option to Replace text matches found using the "Where is" command. This now does nothing. Instead, the option  is  al- ways turned on (as if the -b flag had been specified).

options.title: -d
options.description: Rebind  the  "delete"  key  so the character the cursor is on is rubbed out rather than the character to its left.

options.title: -e
options.description: Enable file name completion.

options.title: -f
options.description: Use function keys for commands.  This option supported  only  in conjunction with UW Enhanced NCSA telnet.

options.title: -h
options.description: List valid command line options.

options.title: -j
options.description: Enable  "Goto"  command  in  the file browser.  This enables the command to permit explicitly telling pilot  which  directory  to visit.

options.title: -g
options.description: Enable  "Show  Cursor" mode in file browser.  Cause cursor to be positioned before the current selection rather  than  placed  at the lower left of the display.

options.title: -k
options.description: Causes  "Cut  Text" command to remove characters from the cursor position to the end of the line rather than  remove  the  entire line.

options.title: -m
options.description: Enable  mouse  functionality.   This only works when pico is run from within an X Window System "xterm" window.

options.title: -nn
options.description: The -nn option enables new mail notification.  The n argument is optional,  and  specifies how often, in seconds, your mailbox is checked for new mail.  For example, -n60 causes  pico  to  check for  new  mail  once  every minute.  The default interval is 180 seconds, while the minimum allowed is 30. (Note:  no  space  be- tween "n" and the number)

options.title: -o dir Sets
options.description: operating directory.  Only files within this directory are

options.title: -rn
options.description: Sets column used to limit the "Justify" command's right margin

options.title: -s speller
options.description: Specify an alternate program spell to use when spell checking.

options.title: -t
options.description: Enable  "tool" mode.  Intended for when pico is used as the edi- tor within other tools (e.g., Elm, Pnews).  Pico will not prompt for  save  on  exit,  and  will not rename the buffer during the "Write Out" command.

options.title: -v
options.description: View the file only, disallowing any editing.

options.title: -version
options.description: Print Pico version and exit.

options.title: -w
options.description: Disable word wrap (thus allow editing of long lines).

options.title: -x
options.description: Disable keymenu at the bottom of the screen.

options.title: -z
options.description: Enable ^Z suspension of pico.

options.title: -p
options.description: Preserve the "start" and "stop" characters, typically Ctrl-Q and Ctrl-S, which are sometimes used in communications paths to con- trol data flow between devices that operate at different speeds.

options.title: -Q quotestr
options.description: Set the quote string.  Especially useful when  composing  email, setting this allows the quote string to be checked for when Jus- tifying paragraphs.  A common quote string is "> ".

options.title: -W word_separators
options.description: If characters listed here appear in the middle of  a  word  sur- rounded  by  alphanumeric characters that word is split into two words. This is used by the Forward and  Backward  word  commands and by the spell checker.

options.title: -q
options.description: Termcap  or  terminfo  definition for input escape sequences are used in preference to sequences defined by default.  This option is only available if pico was compiled with the TERMCAP_WINS de- fine turned on.

options.title: -setlocale_ctype
options.description: Do setlocale(LC_CTYPE) if available. Default is to not  do  this setlocale.

options.title: -no_setlocale_collate
options.description: Do  not  do  setlocale(LC_COLLATE). Default is to do this setlo- cale.
